alert.note: Alert for Galveston; Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 30 at 4:34PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Galveston and Harris. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 434 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Pasadena, League City, Texas City, Dickinson, Seabrook, Webster, Kemah, Nassau Bay, Taylor Lake Village, El Lago, Clear Lake Shores, Kemah Boardwalk, Bacliff and San Leon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
